  • About Us

All 60 aircraft in the AeroGuard Flight Training Center fleet are furnished with air conditioning, standardized cockpits and avionic layouts. It's the standardized configurations across the fleet that greatly enhances safety and simplifies your transition between aircraft models.

AeroGuard aircraft are maintained by an on-site Federal Aviation Administration-approved repair station — operated 24 hours a day by a world-class, professional maintenance staff. The result is an extremely safe fleet of aircraft that boasts an exceptionally high availability rate. Simply put, we have the best training fleet to launch your aviation career.

The AeroGuard fleet includes 3 types of aircraft:

Piper

ARCHER TX - G1000

One of the most popular flight training aircraft in the world, giving you a top-of-the-line, consistent and safe flight training experience. The aircraft is powered by a 180 horsepower piston engine with a fixed-pitch propeller. It's Garmin G1000 glass-panel avionics suite is designed to make flight information easier to scan and process, which improves situational awareness and safety in the cockpit.

Piper

SEMINOLE

An excellent platform for safe multi-engine training flown during the Commercial Multi-Engine course. It has two 180 horsepower piston engines designed with counter rotating, controllable-pitch propellers for optimal control during single-engine operations. While soaring high in the incredible Piper Seminole, you'll gain the multi-engine experience and achieve the time requirements that are mandated by commercial airlines.

Cessna

152

The Cessna 152 is a two-seat, high-wing aircraft with a 110 horsepower piston engine and fixed-pitch propeller. Used during our “Upset Recovery” training, you'll be faced with the challenges of identifying and recovering from unusual flight attitudes, mastering spin recovery and remaining in control of the aircraft during these maneuvers.
